declarations.comments: Choose the first successful element from a foldable container of parsers.
declarations.title: choice

declarations.comments: Attempt a parse, with a default value in case of failure.
declarations.title: option

declarations.comments: Parse something surrounded by given arguments.
declarations.title: bracket

declarations.comments: Parse as many times as possible, giving a `List`.
declarations.title: many

declarations.comments: Parse at least once, giving a `List`.
declarations.title: many1

declarations.comments:
`exactly n p` fails iff `many p` would produce a list of length < n.
However, `exactly n p` will never produce a list of *larger* length.
Example in PSCI:
```purescript
> parse (exactly 3 $ char '6') "6666666"
Just (Cons ('6') (Cons ('6') (Cons ('6'))))
> parse (exactly 3 $ string "Bye) "ByeBye"
Nothing
```
declarations.title: exactly

declarations.comments:
`atLeast n p` fails iff `exactly n p` does, but it differs in that there is
no upper bound on the length of the produced list.
declarations.title: atLeast

declarations.comments: `atMost n p` never fails and never produces a list of length larger than n.
declarations.title: atMost

declarations.comments:
Given a value to parse and a separating parser, put all the values it finds
into a `List`.
Example:
```purescript
> parse (int `sepBy` char ',' <* space) "123,456,789 years ago"
Just (Cons (123) (Cons (456) (Cons (789) (Nil))))
```
declarations.title: sepBy

declarations.comments: Parse one or more occurrences, separated by a delimiter.
declarations.title: sepBy1

declarations.comments:
Does the same as `sepBy`, but requires the separating parser to appear at
the end.
declarations.title: sepEndBy

declarations.comments: Run a parser against an input, either getting an error or a value.
declarations.title: parse

declarations.comments: Get the result of a parse, plus the unparsed input remainder.
declarations.title: unparser

declarations.comments: Change the input to a parser.
declarations.title: modify

declarations.comments: Change the input to a parser, using `Nothing` to signal failure.
declarations.title: modifyM

declarations.comments: Change the input to a parser, using `Left` to signal failure.
declarations.title: modifyE

declarations.comments: A `pure` that doesn't require passing the typeclass dictionary for `Applicative`.
declarations.title: pureP

declarations.comments: A `map` that doesn't require passing the typeclass dictionary for `Functor`.
declarations.title: mapP

declarations.comments: An `apply` that doesn't require passing the typeclass dictionary for `Apply`.
declarations.title: applyP

declarations.comments: A `bind` that doesn't require passing the typeclass dictionary for `Bind`.
declarations.title: bindP

declarations.comments:
Equivalent to (<*) but faster since it doesn't require passing typeclass
dictionaries.
declarations.title: applyL

declarations.comments:
Equivalent to (*>) but faster since it doesn't require passing typeclass
dictionaries.
declarations.title: applyR

declarations.comments: Always fail.
declarations.title: none

declarations.comments: Fail with a message
declarations.title: fail

declarations.comments: If the given parser fails, backtrack to the point of failure.
declarations.title: try

declarations.comments:
Attempt a parse as many times as possible, putting all successes into
a list.
WARNING: Applying this to a parser which never fails and never consumes
input will result in a bottom, i.e. a nonterminating program.
declarations.title: many

declarations.comments: Attempt a parse one or more times.
declarations.title: some

declarations.comments: Find a function's least fixed point using the Z combinator.
declarations.title: fix

declarations.comments: Parse without consuming input.
declarations.title: lookahead

declarations.comments:
`isn't p` succeeds iff p fails, though it will always consume the same
amount of input that p does.
declarations.title: isn't

declarations.comments: Differs from `isn't` in that this never consumes input.
declarations.title: notFollowedBy

declarations.comments: Discard the result of a parse.
declarations.title: skip

declarations.comments:
Attempt a parse subject to a predicate. If the parse succeeds but the
predicate does not hold, the resulting parse fails *without* backtracking.
If the parse fails, it will backtrack.
declarations.title: suchThat

declarations.comments: Matches the unparsed portion of the input.
declarations.title: tail

declarations.comments: Parse a single `Char`.
declarations.title: item

declarations.comments: A generalized `item` for arbitrary streams that can be `uncons`ed.
declarations.title: first

declarations.comments:
## Backtracking combinators
Create a parser from a `Char`acteristic function.
declarations.title: sat

declarations.comments: Match any character not in the foldable container.
declarations.title: isn'tAnyF

declarations.comments:
Match any character not in the string.
Equivalent to `isn'tAnyF <<< toCharArray`.
declarations.title: isn'tAny

declarations.comments: Match any character in the foldable container.
declarations.title: anyOfF

declarations.comments:
Match any character in the string.
Equivalent to `anyOfF <<< toCharArray`.
declarations.title: anyOf

declarations.comments: Parse a lowercase character.
declarations.title: lower

declarations.comments: Parse an uppercase character.
declarations.title: upper

declarations.comments: Parse a letter or a digit.
declarations.title: alphanum

declarations.comments: Parse a carriage return.
declarations.title: cr

declarations.comments: ## Non-backtracking combinators
declarations.title: sat'

declarations.comments: ## Higher-order combinators
declarations.title: whitespaces

declarations.comments:
Parse a natural number amount of a given `Char` parser, resulting in a
`String`.
declarations.title: manyChar

declarations.comments:
Parse a positive integral amount of a given `Char` parser, resulting in a
`String`.
declarations.title: someChar

declarations.comments: Contiguous strings with no tabs, spaces, carriage returns or newlines.
declarations.title: word

declarations.comments: Parse the end of a file, returning `Unit` to indicate success.
declarations.title: eof

declarations.comments:
Parse an integer value as a `String`. Useful if needing to parse integers
that are outside of `Int`'s bounds. You could then combine this with, e.g.
`purescript-hugenum`'s `Data.HugeInt.fromString`.
declarations.title: integral

declarations.comments:
Parse an `Int`. Note that this parser will fail if the candidate would be
outside the range of allowable `Int`s.
declarations.title: int

declarations.comments: Parse a `Number`. The string must have digits surrounding a decimal point.
declarations.title: number
